Browse the source code of netbsd/external/mpl/dhcp/dist/relay/dhcrelay.c

1/* $NetBSD: dhcrelay.c,v 1.2 2018/04/07 22:37:30 christos Exp $ */
2
3/* dhcrelay.c
4
5 DHCP/BOOTP Relay Agent. */
6

13 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
14 *
15 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND ISC DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES
16 * WITH REGARD TO THIS SOFTWARE INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
17 * MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS. IN NO EVENT SHALL ISC BE LIABLE FOR
18 * ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES
19 * WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN
20 * ACTION OF CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT
21 * OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.
22 *

24 * 950 Charter Street
25 * Redwood City, CA 94063
26 * <info@isc.org>
27 * https://www.isc.org/

31#include <sys/cdefs.h>
32__RCSID("$NetBSD: dhcrelay.c,v 1.2 2018/04/07 22:37:30 christos Exp $");
33
34#include "dhcpd.h"
35#include <syslog.h>
36#include <signal.h>
37#include <sys/time.h>
38#include <isc/file.h>
39
40TIME default_lease_time = 43200; /* 12 hours... */
41TIME max_lease_time = 86400; /* 24 hours... */
42struct tree_cache *global_options[256];
43
44struct option *requested_opts[2];
45
46/* Needed to prevent linking against conflex.c. */
47int lexline;
48int lexchar;
49char *token_line;
50char *tlname;
51
52const char *path_dhcrelay_pid = _PATH_DHCRELAY_PID;
53isc_boolean_t no_dhcrelay_pid = ISC_FALSE;
54/* False (default) => we write and use a pid file */
55isc_boolean_t no_pid_file = ISC_FALSE;
56
57int bogus_agent_drops = 0; /* Packets dropped because agent option
58 field was specified and we're not relaying
59 packets that already have an agent option
60 specified. */
61int bogus_giaddr_drops = 0; /* Packets sent to us to relay back to a
62 client, but with a bogus giaddr. */
63int client_packets_relayed = 0; /* Packets relayed from client to server. */
64int server_packet_errors = 0; /* Errors sending packets to servers. */
65int server_packets_relayed = 0; /* Packets relayed from server to client. */
66int client_packet_errors = 0; /* Errors sending packets to clients. */
67
68int add_agent_options = 0; /* If nonzero, add relay agent options. */
69int add_rfc3527_suboption = 0; /* If nonzero, add RFC3527 link selection sub-option. */
70
71int agent_option_errors = 0; /* Number of packets forwarded without
72 agent options because there was no room. */
73int drop_agent_mismatches = 0; /* If nonzero, drop server replies that
74 don't have matching circuit-id's. */
75int corrupt_agent_options = 0; /* Number of packets dropped because
76 relay agent information option was bad. */
77int missing_agent_option = 0; /* Number of packets dropped because no
78 RAI option matching our ID was found. */
79int bad_circuit_id = 0; /* Circuit ID option in matching RAI option
80 did not match any known circuit ID. */
81int missing_circuit_id = 0; /* Circuit ID option in matching RAI option
82 was missing. */
83int max_hop_count = 10; /* Maximum hop count */
84
85int no_daemon = 0;
86int dfd[2] = { -1, -1 };
87
88#ifdef DHCPv6
89 /* Force use of DHCPv6 interface-id option. */
90isc_boolean_t use_if_id = ISC_FALSE;
91#endif
92
93 /* Maximum size of a packet with agent options added. */
94int dhcp_max_agent_option_packet_length = DHCP_MTU_MIN;
95
96 /* What to do about packets we're asked to relay that
97 already have a relay option: */
98enum { forward_and_append, /* Forward and append our own relay option. */
99 forward_and_replace, /* Forward, but replace theirs with ours. */
100 forward_untouched, /* Forward without changes. */
101 discard } agent_relay_mode = forward_and_replace;
102
103u_int16_t local_port = 0;
104u_int16_t remote_port = 0;
105
106/* Relay agent server list. */
107struct server_list {
108 struct server_list *next;
109 struct sockaddr_in to;
110} *servers;
111
112struct interface_info *uplink = NULL;
113
114#ifdef DHCPv6
115struct stream_list {
116 struct stream_list *next;
117 struct interface_info *ifp;
118 struct sockaddr_in6 link;
119 int id;
120} *downstreams, *upstreams;
121
122static struct stream_list *parse_downstream(char *);
123static struct stream_list *parse_upstream(char *);
124static void setup_streams(void);
125
126/*
127 * A pointer to a subscriber id to add to the message we forward.
128 * This is primarily for testing purposes as we only have one id
129 * for the entire relay and don't determine one per client which
130 * would be more useful.
131 */
132char *dhcrelay_sub_id = NULL;
133#endif
134
135libdhcp_callbacks_t dhcrelay_callbacks = {
136 &local_port,
137 &remote_port,
138 classify,
139 check_collection,
140 dhcp,
141#ifdef DHCPv6
142 dhcpv6,
143#endif /* DHCPv6 */
144 bootp,
145 find_class,
146 parse_allow_deny,
147 dhcp_set_control_state,
148};
149
150static void do_relay4(struct interface_info *, struct dhcp_packet *,
151 unsigned int, unsigned int, struct iaddr,
152 struct hardware *);
153static int add_relay_agent_options(struct interface_info *,
154 struct dhcp_packet *, unsigned,
155 struct in_addr);
156static int find_interface_by_agent_option(struct dhcp_packet *,
157 struct interface_info **, u_int8_t *, int);
158static int strip_relay_agent_options(struct interface_info *,
159 struct interface_info **,
160 struct dhcp_packet *, unsigned);
161
162static void request_v4_interface(const char* name, int flags);
163
164static const char copyright[] =
165"Copyright 2004-2018 Internet Systems Consortium.";
166static const char arr[] = "All rights reserved.";
167static const char message[] =
168"Internet Systems Consortium DHCP Relay Agent";
169static const char url[] =
170"For info, please visit https://www.isc.org/software/dhcp/";
171
172char *progname;
173
174#ifdef DHCPv6
175#ifdef RELAY_PORT
176#define DHCRELAY_USAGE \
177"Usage: %s [-4] [-d] [-q] [-a] [-D]\n" \
178" [-A <length>] [-c <hops>]\n" \
179" [-p <port> | -rp <relay-port>]\n" \
180" [-pf <pid-file>] [--no-pid]\n"\
181" [-m append|replace|forward|discard]\n" \
182" [-i interface0 [ ... -i interfaceN]\n" \
183" [-iu interface0 [ ... -iu interfaceN]\n" \
184" [-id interface0 [ ... -id interfaceN]\n" \
185" [-U interface]\n" \
186" server0 [ ... serverN]\n\n" \
187" %s -6 [-d] [-q] [-I] [-c <hops>]\n" \
188" [-p <port> | -rp <relay-port>]\n" \
189" [-pf <pid-file>] [--no-pid]\n" \
190" [-s <subscriber-id>]\n" \
191" -l lower0 [ ... -l lowerN]\n" \
192" -u upper0 [ ... -u upperN]\n" \
193" lower (client link): [address%%]interface[#index]\n" \
194" upper (server link): [address%%]interface\n\n" \
195" %s {--version|--help|-h}"
196#else
197#define DHCRELAY_USAGE \
198"Usage: %s [-4] [-d] [-q] [-a] [-D]\n" \
199" [-A <length>] [-c <hops>] [-p <port>]\n" \
200" [-pf <pid-file>] [--no-pid]\n"\
201" [-m append|replace|forward|discard]\n" \
202" [-i interface0 [ ... -i interfaceN]\n" \
203" [-iu interface0 [ ... -iu interfaceN]\n" \
204" [-id interface0 [ ... -id interfaceN]\n" \
205" [-U interface]\n" \
206" server0 [ ... serverN]\n\n" \
207" %s -6 [-d] [-q] [-I] [-c <hops>] [-p <port>]\n" \
208" [-pf <pid-file>] [--no-pid]\n" \
209" [-s <subscriber-id>]\n" \
210" -l lower0 [ ... -l lowerN]\n" \
211" -u upper0 [ ... -u upperN]\n" \
212" lower (client link): [address%%]interface[#index]\n" \
213" upper (server link): [address%%]interface\n\n" \
214" %s {--version|--help|-h}"
215#endif
216#else /* !DHCPv6 */
217#ifdef RELAY_PORT
218#define DHCRELAY_USAGE \
219"Usage: %s [-d] [-q] [-a] [-D] [-A <length>] [-c <hops>]\n" \
220" [-p <port> | -rp <relay-port>]\n" \
221" [-pf <pid-file>] [--no-pid]\n" \
222" [-m append|replace|forward|discard]\n" \
223" [-i interface0 [ ... -i interfaceN]\n" \
224" [-iu interface0 [ ... -iu interfaceN]\n" \
225" [-id interface0 [ ... -id interfaceN]\n" \
226" [-U interface]\n" \
227" server0 [ ... serverN]\n\n" \
228" %s {--version|--help|-h}"
229#else
230#define DHCRELAY_USAGE \
231"Usage: %s [-d] [-q] [-a] [-D] [-A <length>] [-c <hops>] [-p <port>]\n" \
232" [-pf <pid-file>] [--no-pid]\n" \
233" [-m append|replace|forward|discard]\n" \
234" [-i interface0 [ ... -i interfaceN]\n" \
235" [-iu interface0 [ ... -iu interfaceN]\n" \
236" [-id interface0 [ ... -id interfaceN]\n" \
237" [-U interface]\n" \
238" server0 [ ... serverN]\n\n" \
239" %s {--version|--help|-h}"
240#endif
241#endif
242
243/*!
244 *
245 * \brief Print the generic usage message
246 *
247 * If the user has provided an incorrect command line print out
248 * the description of the command line. The arguments provide
249 * a way for the caller to request more specific information about
250 * the error be printed as well. Mostly this will be that some
251 * comamnd doesn't include its argument.
252 *
253 * \param sfmt - The basic string and format for the specific error
254 * \param sarg - Generally the offending argument from the comamnd line.
255 *
256 * \return Nothing
257 */
258
259#include <sys/cdefs.h>
260__RCSID("$NetBSD: dhcrelay.c,v 1.2 2018/04/07 22:37:30 christos Exp $");
261static const char use_noarg[] = "No argument for command: %s";
262#ifdef RELAY_PORT
263static const char use_port_defined[] = "Port already set, %s inappropriate";
264#if !defined (USE_BPF_RECEIVE) && !defined (USE_LPF_RECEIVE)
265static const char bpf_sock_support[] = "Only LPF and BPF are supported: %s";
266#endif
267#endif
268#ifdef DHCPv6
269static const char use_badproto[] = "Protocol already set, %s inappropriate";
270static const char use_v4command[] = "Command not used for DHCPv6: %s";
271static const char use_v6command[] = "Command not used for DHCPv4: %s";
272#endif
273
274static void
275usage(const char *sfmt, const char *sarg) {
276 log_info("%s %s", message, PACKAGE_VERSION);
277 log_info(copyright);
278 log_info(arr);
279 log_info(url);
280
281 /* If desired print out the specific error message */
282#ifdef PRINT_SPECIFIC_CL_ERRORS
283 if (sfmt != NULL)
284 log_error(sfmt, sarg);
285#endif
286
287 log_fatal(DHCRELAY_USAGE,
288#ifdef DHCPv6
289 isc_file_basename(progname),
290#endif
291 isc_file_basename(progname),
292 isc_file_basename(progname));
293}
294
295int
296main(int argc, char **argv) {
297 isc_result_t status;
298 struct servent *ent;
299 struct server_list *sp = NULL;
300 char *service_local = NULL, *service_remote = NULL;
301 u_int16_t port_local = 0, port_remote = 0;
302 int quiet = 0;
303 int fd;
304 int i;
305#ifdef RELAY_PORT
306 int port_defined = 0;
307#endif
308#ifdef DHCPv6
309 struct stream_list *sl = NULL;
310 int local_family_set = 0;
311#endif
312
313#ifdef OLD_LOG_NAME
314 progname = "dhcrelay";
315#else
316 progname = argv[0];
317#endif
318
319 /* Make sure that file descriptors 0(stdin), 1,(stdout), and
320 2(stderr) are open. To do this, we assume that when we
321 open a file the lowest available file descriptor is used. */
322 fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
323 if (fd == 0)
324 fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
325 if (fd == 1)
326 fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
327 if (fd == 2)
328 log_perror = 0; /* No sense logging to /dev/null. */
329 else if (fd != -1)
330 close(fd);
331
332 openlog(isc_file_basename(progname), DHCP_LOG_OPTIONS, LOG_DAEMON);
333
334#if !defined(DEBUG)
335 setlogmask(LOG_UPTO(LOG_INFO));
336#endif
337
338 /* Parse arguments changing no_daemon */
339 for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
340 if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-d")) {
341 no_daemon = 1;
342 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "--version")) {
343 log_info("isc-dhcrelay-%s", PACKAGE_VERSION);
344 exit(0);
345 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "--help") ||
346 !strcmp(argv[i], "-h")) {
347 log_info(DHCRELAY_USAGE,
348#ifdef DHCPv6
349 isc_file_basename(progname),
350#endif
351 isc_file_basename(progname),
352 isc_file_basename(progname));
353 exit(0);
354 }
355 }
356 /* When not forbidden prepare to become a daemon */
357 if (!no_daemon) {
358 int pid;
359
360 if (pipe(dfd) == -1)
361 log_fatal("Can't get pipe: %m");
362 if ((pid = fork ()) < 0)
363 log_fatal("Can't fork daemon: %m");
364 if (pid != 0) {
365 /* Parent: wait for the child to start */
366 int n;
367
368 (void) close(dfd[1]);
369 do {
370 char buf;
371
372 n = read(dfd[0], &buf, 1);
373 if (n == 1)
374 _exit(0);
375 } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
376 _exit(1);
377 }
378 /* Child */
379 (void) close(dfd[0]);
380 }
381
382
383 /* Set up the isc and dns library managers */
384 status = dhcp_context_create(DHCP_CONTEXT_PRE_DB, NULL, NULL);
385 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
386 log_fatal("Can't initialize context: %s",
387 isc_result_totext(status));
388
389 /* Set up the OMAPI. */
390 status = omapi_init();
391 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
392 log_fatal("Can't initialize OMAPI: %s",
393 isc_result_totext(status));
394
395 /* Set up the OMAPI wrappers for the interface object. */
396 interface_setup();
397
398 for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
399 if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-4")) {
400#ifdef DHCPv6
401 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
402 usage(use_badproto, "-4");
403 }
404 local_family_set = 1;
405 local_family = AF_INET;
406 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-6")) {
407 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET)) {
408 usage(use_badproto, "-6");
409 }
410 local_family_set = 1;
411 local_family = AF_INET6;
412#endif
413 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-d")) {
414 /* no_daemon = 1; */
415 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-q")) {
416 quiet = 1;
417 quiet_interface_discovery = 1;
418 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-p")) {
419 if (++i == argc)
420 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
421#ifdef RELAY_PORT
422 if (port_defined)
423 usage(use_port_defined, argv[i-1]);
424 port_defined = 1;
425#endif
426 local_port = validate_port(argv[i]);
427 log_debug("binding to user-specified port %d",
428 ntohs(local_port));
429#ifdef RELAY_PORT
430 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-rp")) {
431 if (++i == argc)
432 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
433 if (port_defined)
434 usage(use_port_defined, argv[i-1]);
435 port_defined = 1;
436 relay_port = validate_port(argv[i]);
437 log_debug("binding to user-specified relay port %d",
438 ntohs(relay_port));
439 add_agent_options = 1;
440#endif
441 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-c")) {
442 int hcount;
443 if (++i == argc)
444 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
445 hcount = atoi(argv[i]);
446 if (hcount <= 255)
447 max_hop_count= hcount;
448 else
449 usage("Bad hop count to -c: %s", argv[i]);
450 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-i")) {
451#ifdef DHCPv6
452 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
453 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
454 }
455 local_family_set = 1;
456 local_family = AF_INET;
457#endif
458 if (++i == argc) {
459 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
460 }
461
462 request_v4_interface(argv[i], INTERFACE_STREAMS);
463 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-iu")) {
464#ifdef DHCPv6
465 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
466 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
467 }
468 local_family_set = 1;
469 local_family = AF_INET;
470#endif
471 if (++i == argc) {
472 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
473 }
474
475 request_v4_interface(argv[i], INTERFACE_UPSTREAM);
476 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-id")) {
477#ifdef DHCPv6
478 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
479 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
480 }
481 local_family_set = 1;
482 local_family = AF_INET;
483#endif
484 if (++i == argc) {
485 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
486 }
487
488 request_v4_interface(argv[i], INTERFACE_DOWNSTREAM);
489 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-a")) {
490#ifdef DHCPv6
491 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
492 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
493 }
494 local_family_set = 1;
495 local_family = AF_INET;
496#endif
497 add_agent_options = 1;
498 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-A")) {
499#ifdef DHCPv6
500 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
501 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
502 }
503 local_family_set = 1;
504 local_family = AF_INET;
505#endif
506 if (++i == argc)
507 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
508
509 dhcp_max_agent_option_packet_length = atoi(argv[i]);
510
511 if (dhcp_max_agent_option_packet_length > DHCP_MTU_MAX)
512 log_fatal("%s: packet length exceeds "
513 "longest possible MTU\n",
514 argv[i]);
515 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-m")) {
516#ifdef DHCPv6
517 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
518 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
519 }
520 local_family_set = 1;
521 local_family = AF_INET;
522#endif
523 if (++i == argc)
524 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
525 if (!strcasecmp(argv[i], "append")) {
526 agent_relay_mode = forward_and_append;
527 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[i], "replace")) {
528 agent_relay_mode = forward_and_replace;
529 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[i], "forward")) {
530 agent_relay_mode = forward_untouched;
531 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[i], "discard")) {
532 agent_relay_mode = discard;
533 } else
534 usage("Unknown argument to -m: %s", argv[i]);
535 } else if (!strcmp(argv [i], "-U")) {
536 if (++i == argc)
537 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
538
539 if (uplink) {
540 usage("more than one uplink (-U) specified: %s"
541 ,argv[i]);
542 }
543
544 /* Allocate the uplink interface */
545 status = interface_allocate(&uplink, MDL);
546 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
547 log_fatal("%s: uplink interface_allocate: %s",
548 argv[i], isc_result_totext(status));
549 }
550
551 if (strlen(argv[i]) >= sizeof(uplink->name)) {
552 log_fatal("%s: uplink name too long,"
553 " it cannot exceed: %ld characters",
554 argv[i], (long)(sizeof(uplink->name) - 1));
555 }
556
557 uplink->name[sizeof(uplink->name) - 1] = 0x00;
558 strncpy(uplink->name, argv[i],
559 sizeof(uplink->name) - 1);
560 interface_snorf(uplink, (INTERFACE_REQUESTED |
561 INTERFACE_STREAMS));
562
563 /* Turn on -a, in case they don't do so explicitly */
564 add_agent_options = 1;
565 add_rfc3527_suboption = 1;
566 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-D")) {
567#ifdef DHCPv6
568 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
569 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
570 }
571 local_family_set = 1;
572 local_family = AF_INET;
573#endif
574 drop_agent_mismatches = 1;
575#ifdef DHCPv6
576 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-I")) {
577 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET)) {
578 usage(use_v6command, argv[i]);
579 }
580 local_family_set = 1;
581 local_family = AF_INET6;
582 use_if_id = ISC_TRUE;
583 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-l")) {
584 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET)) {
585 usage(use_v6command, argv[i]);
586 }
587 local_family_set = 1;
588 local_family = AF_INET6;
589 if (downstreams != NULL)
590 use_if_id = ISC_TRUE;
591 if (++i == argc)
592 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
593 sl = parse_downstream(argv[i]);
594 sl->next = downstreams;
595 downstreams = sl;
596 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-u")) {
597 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET)) {
598 usage(use_v6command, argv[i]);
599 }
600 local_family_set = 1;
601 local_family = AF_INET6;
602 if (++i == argc)
603 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
604 sl = parse_upstream(argv[i]);
605 sl->next = upstreams;
606 upstreams = sl;
607 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-s")) {
608 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET)) {
609 usage(use_v6command, argv[i]);
610 }
611 local_family_set = 1;
612 local_family = AF_INET6;
613 if (++i == argc)
614 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
615 dhcrelay_sub_id = argv[i];
616#endif
617 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-pf")) {
618 if (++i == argc)
619 usage(use_noarg, argv[i-1]);
620 path_dhcrelay_pid = argv[i];
621 no_dhcrelay_pid = ISC_TRUE;
622 } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "--no-pid")) {
623 no_pid_file = ISC_TRUE;
624 } else if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
625 usage("Unknown command: %s", argv[i]);
626 } else {
627 struct hostent *he;
628 struct in_addr ia, *iap = NULL;
629
630#ifdef DHCPv6
631 if (local_family_set && (local_family == AF_INET6)) {
632 usage(use_v4command, argv[i]);
633 }
634 local_family_set = 1;
635 local_family = AF_INET;
636#endif
637 if (inet_aton(argv[i], &ia)) {
638 iap = &ia;
639 } else {
640 he = gethostbyname(argv[i]);
641 if (!he) {
642 log_error("%s: host unknown", argv[i]);
643 } else {
644 iap = ((struct in_addr *)
645 he->h_addr_list[0]);
646 }
647 }
648
649 if (iap) {
650 sp = ((struct server_list *)
651 dmalloc(sizeof *sp, MDL));
652 if (!sp)
653 log_fatal("no memory for server.\n");
654 sp->next = servers;
655 servers = sp;
656 memcpy(&sp->to.sin_addr, iap, sizeof *iap);
657 }
658 }
659 }
660
661#if defined(RELAY_PORT) && \
662 !defined (USE_BPF_RECEIVE) && !defined (USE_LPF_RECEIVE)
663 if (relay_port && (local_family == AF_INET))
664 usage(bpf_sock_support, "-rp");
665#endif
666
667 /*
668 * If the user didn't specify a pid file directly
669 * find one from environment variables or defaults
670 */
671 if (no_dhcrelay_pid == ISC_FALSE) {
672 if (local_family == AF_INET) {
673 path_dhcrelay_pid = getenv("PATH_DHCRELAY_PID");
674 if (path_dhcrelay_pid == NULL)
675 path_dhcrelay_pid = _PATH_DHCRELAY_PID;
676 }
677#ifdef DHCPv6
678 else {
679 path_dhcrelay_pid = getenv("PATH_DHCRELAY6_PID");
680 if (path_dhcrelay_pid == NULL)
681 path_dhcrelay_pid = _PATH_DHCRELAY6_PID;
682 }
683#endif
684 }
685
686 if (!quiet) {
687 log_info("%s %s", message, PACKAGE_VERSION);
688 log_info(copyright);
689 log_info(arr);
690 log_info(url);
691 } else
692 log_perror = 0;
693
694 /* Set default port */
695 if (local_family == AF_INET) {
696 service_local = "bootps";
697 service_remote = "bootpc";
698 port_local = htons(67);
699 port_remote = htons(68);
700 }
701#ifdef DHCPv6
702 else {
703 service_local = "dhcpv6-server";
704 service_remote = "dhcpv6-client";
705 port_local = htons(547);
706 port_remote = htons(546);
707 }
708#endif
709
710 if (!local_port) {
711 ent = getservbyname(service_local, "udp");
712 if (ent)
713 local_port = ent->s_port;
714 else
715 local_port = port_local;
716
717 ent = getservbyname(service_remote, "udp");
718 if (ent)
719 remote_port = ent->s_port;
720 else
721 remote_port = port_remote;
722
723 endservent();
724 }
725
726 if (local_family == AF_INET) {
727 /* We need at least one server */
728 if (servers == NULL) {
729 log_fatal("No servers specified.");
730 }
731
732
733 /* Set up the server sockaddrs. */
734 for (sp = servers; sp; sp = sp->next) {
735 sp->to.sin_port = local_port;
736 sp->to.sin_family = AF_INET;
737#ifdef HAVE_SA_LEN
738 sp->to.sin_len = sizeof sp->to;
739#endif
740 }
741 }
742#ifdef DHCPv6
743 else {
744 unsigned code;
745
746 /* We need at least one upstream and one downstream interface */
747 if (upstreams == NULL || downstreams == NULL) {
748 log_info("Must specify at least one lower "
749 "and one upper interface.\n");
750 usage(NULL, NULL);
751 }
752
753 /* Set up the initial dhcp option universe. */
754 initialize_common_option_spaces();
755
756 /* Check requested options. */
757 code = D6O_RELAY_MSG;
758 if (!option_code_hash_lookup(&requested_opts[0],
759 dhcpv6_universe.code_hash,
760 &code, 0, MDL))
761 log_fatal("Unable to find the RELAY_MSG "
762 "option definition.");
763 code = D6O_INTERFACE_ID;
764 if (!option_code_hash_lookup(&requested_opts[1],
765 dhcpv6_universe.code_hash,
766 &code, 0, MDL))
767 log_fatal("Unable to find the INTERFACE_ID "
768 "option definition.");
769 }
770#endif
771
772 /* Become a daemon... */
773 if (!no_daemon) {
774 char buf = 0;
775 FILE *pf;
776 int pfdesc;
777
778 log_perror = 0;
779
780 /* Signal parent we started successfully. */
781 if (dfd[0] != -1 && dfd[1] != -1) {
782 if (write(dfd[1], &buf, 1) != 1)
783 log_fatal("write to parent: %m");
784 (void) close(dfd[1]);
785 dfd[0] = dfd[1] = -1;
786 }
787
788 /* Create the pid file. */
789 if (no_pid_file == ISC_FALSE) {
790 pfdesc = open(path_dhcrelay_pid,
791 O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_WRONLY, 0644);
792
793 if (pfdesc < 0) {
794 log_error("Can't create %s: %m",
795 path_dhcrelay_pid);
796 } else {
797 pf = fdopen(pfdesc, "w");
798 if (!pf)
799 log_error("Can't fdopen %s: %m",
800 path_dhcrelay_pid);
801 else {
802 fprintf(pf, "%ld\n",(long)getpid());
803 fclose(pf);
804 }
805 }
806 }
807
808 (void) close(0);
809 (void) close(1);
810 (void) close(2);
811 (void) setsid();
812
813 IGNORE_RET (chdir("/"));
814 }
815
816 /* Set up the isc and dns library managers */
817 status = dhcp_context_create(DHCP_CONTEXT_PRE_DB | DHCP_CONTEXT_POST_DB,
818 NULL, NULL);
819 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
820 log_fatal("Can't initialize context: %s",
821 isc_result_totext(status));
822
823 /* Get the current time... */
824 gettimeofday(&cur_tv, NULL);
825
826 /* Discover all the network interfaces. */
827 discover_interfaces(DISCOVER_RELAY);
828
829#ifdef DHCPv6
830 if (local_family == AF_INET6)
831 setup_streams();
832#endif
833
834 /* Set up the packet handler... */
835 if (local_family == AF_INET)
836 bootp_packet_handler = do_relay4;
837#ifdef DHCPv6
838 else
839 dhcpv6_packet_handler = do_packet6;
840#endif
841
842#if defined(ENABLE_GENTLE_SHUTDOWN)
843 /* no signal handlers until we deal with the side effects */
844 /* install signal handlers */
845 signal(SIGINT, dhcp_signal_handler); /* control-c */
846 signal(SIGTERM, dhcp_signal_handler); /* kill */
847#endif
848
849 /* Start dispatching packets and timeouts... */
850 dispatch();
851
852 /* In fact dispatch() never returns. */
853 return (0);
854}
855
856static void
857do_relay4(struct interface_info *ip, struct dhcp_packet *packet,
858 unsigned int length, unsigned int from_port, struct iaddr from,
859 struct hardware *hfrom) {
860 struct server_list *sp;
861 struct sockaddr_in to;
862 struct interface_info *out;
863 struct hardware hto, *htop;
864
865 if (packet->hlen > sizeof packet->chaddr) {
866 log_info("Discarding packet with invalid hlen, received on "
867 "%s interface.", ip->name);
868 return;
869 }
870 if (ip->address_count < 1 || ip->addresses == NULL) {
871 log_info("Discarding packet received on %s interface that "
872 "has no IPv4 address assigned.", ip->name);
873 return;
874 }
875
876 /* Find the interface that corresponds to the giaddr
877 in the packet. */
878 if (packet->giaddr.s_addr) {
879 for (out = interfaces; out; out = out->next) {
880 int i;
881
882 for (i = 0 ; i < out->address_count ; i++ ) {
883 if (out->addresses[i].s_addr ==
884 packet->giaddr.s_addr) {
885 i = -1;
886 break;
887 }
888 }
889
890 if (i == -1)
891 break;
892 }
893 } else {
894 out = NULL;
895 }
896
897 /* If it's a bootreply, forward it to the client. */
898 if (packet->op == BOOTREPLY) {
899 if (!(ip->flags & INTERFACE_UPSTREAM)) {
900 log_debug("Dropping reply received on %s", ip->name);
901 return;
902 }
903
904 if (!(packet->flags & htons(BOOTP_BROADCAST)) &&
905 can_unicast_without_arp(out)) {
906 to.sin_addr = packet->yiaddr;
907 to.sin_port = remote_port;
908
909 /* and hardware address is not broadcast */
910 htop = &hto;
911 } else {
912 to.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_BROADCAST);
913 to.sin_port = remote_port;
914
915 /* hardware address is broadcast */
916 htop = NULL;
917 }
918 to.sin_family = AF_INET;
919#ifdef HAVE_SA_LEN
920 to.sin_len = sizeof to;
921#endif
922
923 memcpy(&hto.hbuf[1], packet->chaddr, packet->hlen);
924 hto.hbuf[0] = packet->htype;
925 hto.hlen = packet->hlen + 1;
926
927 /* Wipe out the agent relay options and, if possible, figure
928 out which interface to use based on the contents of the
929 option that we put on the request to which the server is
930 replying. */
931 if (!(length =
932 strip_relay_agent_options(ip, &out, packet, length)))
933 return;
934
935 if (!out) {
936 log_error("Packet to bogus giaddr %s.\n",
937 inet_ntoa(packet->giaddr));
938 ++bogus_giaddr_drops;
939 return;
940 }
941
942 if (send_packet(out, NULL, packet, length, out->addresses[0],
943 &to, htop) < 0) {
944 ++server_packet_errors;
945 } else {
946 log_debug("Forwarded BOOTREPLY for %s to %s",
947 print_hw_addr(packet->htype, packet->hlen,
948 packet->chaddr),
949 inet_ntoa(to.sin_addr));
950
951 ++server_packets_relayed;
952 }
953 return;
954 }
955
956 /* If giaddr matches one of our addresses, ignore the packet -
957 we just sent it. */
958 if (out)
959 return;
960
961 if (!(ip->flags & INTERFACE_DOWNSTREAM)) {
962 log_debug("Dropping request received on %s", ip->name);
963 return;
964 }
965
966 /* Add relay agent options if indicated. If something goes wrong,
967 * drop the packet. Note this may set packet->giaddr if RFC3527
968 * is enabled. */
969 if (!(length = add_relay_agent_options(ip, packet, length,
970 ip->addresses[0])))
971 return;
972
973 /* If giaddr is not already set, Set it so the server can
974 figure out what net it's from and so that we can later
975 forward the response to the correct net. If it's already
976 set, the response will be sent directly to the relay agent
977 that set giaddr, so we won't see it. */
978 if (!packet->giaddr.s_addr)
979 packet->giaddr = ip->addresses[0];
980 if (packet->hops < max_hop_count)
981 packet->hops = packet->hops + 1;
982 else
983 return;
984
985 /* Otherwise, it's a BOOTREQUEST, so forward it to all the
986 servers. */
987 for (sp = servers; sp; sp = sp->next) {
988 if (send_packet((fallback_interface
989 ? fallback_interface : interfaces),
990 NULL, packet, length, ip->addresses[0],
991 &sp->to, NULL) < 0) {
992 ++client_packet_errors;
993 } else {
994 log_debug("Forwarded BOOTREQUEST for %s to %s",
995 print_hw_addr(packet->htype, packet->hlen,
996 packet->chaddr),
997 inet_ntoa(sp->to.sin_addr));
998 ++client_packets_relayed;
999 }
1000 }
1001
1002}
1003
1004/* Strip any Relay Agent Information options from the DHCP packet
1005 option buffer. If there is a circuit ID suboption, look up the
1006 outgoing interface based upon it. */
1007
1008static int
1009strip_relay_agent_options(struct interface_info *in,
1010 struct interface_info **out,
1011 struct dhcp_packet *packet,
1012 unsigned length) {
1013 int is_dhcp = 0;
1014 u_int8_t *op, *nextop, *sp, *max;
1015 int good_agent_option = 0;
1016 int status;
1017
1018 /* If we're not adding agent options to packets, we're not taking
1019 them out either. */
1020 if (!add_agent_options)
1021 return (length);
1022
1023 /* If there's no cookie, it's a bootp packet, so we should just
1024 forward it unchanged. */
1025 if (memcmp(packet->options, DHCP_OPTIONS_COOKIE, 4))
1026 return (length);
1027
1028 max = ((u_int8_t *)packet) + length;
1029 sp = op = &packet->options[4];
1030
1031 while (op < max) {
1032 switch(*op) {
1033 /* Skip padding... */
1034 case DHO_PAD:
1035 if (sp != op)
1036 *sp = *op;
1037 ++op;
1038 ++sp;
1039 continue;
1040
1041 /* If we see a message type, it's a DHCP packet. */
1042 case DHO_DHCP_MESSAGE_TYPE:
1043 is_dhcp = 1;
1044 goto skip;
1045 break;
1046
1047 /* Quit immediately if we hit an End option. */
1048 case DHO_END:
1049 if (sp != op)
1050 *sp++ = *op++;
1051 goto out;
1052
1053 case DHO_DHCP_AGENT_OPTIONS:
1054 /* We shouldn't see a relay agent option in a
1055 packet before we've seen the DHCP packet type,
1056 but if we do, we have to leave it alone. */
1057 if (!is_dhcp)
1058 goto skip;
1059
1060 /* Do not process an agent option if it exceeds the
1061 * buffer. Fail this packet.
1062 */
1063 nextop = op + op[1] + 2;
1064 if (nextop > max)
1065 return (0);
1066
1067 status = find_interface_by_agent_option(packet,
1068 out, op + 2,
1069 op[1]);
1070 if (status == -1 && drop_agent_mismatches)
1071 return (0);
1072 if (status)
1073 good_agent_option = 1;
1074 op = nextop;
1075 break;
1076
1077 skip:
1078 /* Skip over other options. */
1079 default:
1080 /* Fail if processing this option will exceed the
1081 * buffer(op[1] is malformed).
1082 */
1083 nextop = op + op[1] + 2;
1084 if (nextop > max)
1085 return (0);
1086
1087 if (sp != op) {
1088 memmove(sp, op, op[1] + 2);
1089 sp += op[1] + 2;
1090 op = nextop;
1091 } else
1092 op = sp = nextop;
1093
1094 break;
1095 }
1096 }
1097 out:
1098
1099 /* If it's not a DHCP packet, we're not supposed to touch it. */
1100 if (!is_dhcp)
1101 return (length);
1102
1103 /* If none of the agent options we found matched, or if we didn't
1104 find any agent options, count this packet as not having any
1105 matching agent options, and if we're relying on agent options
1106 to determine the outgoing interface, drop the packet. */
1107
1108 if (!good_agent_option) {
1109 ++missing_agent_option;
1110 if (drop_agent_mismatches)
1111 return (0);
1112 }
1113
1114 /* Adjust the length... */
1115 if (sp != op) {
1116 length = sp -((u_int8_t *)packet);
1117
1118 /* Make sure the packet isn't short(this is unlikely,
1119 but WTH) */
1120 if (length < BOOTP_MIN_LEN) {
1121 memset(sp, DHO_PAD, BOOTP_MIN_LEN - length);
1122 length = BOOTP_MIN_LEN;
1123 }
1124 }
1125 return (length);
1126}
1127
1128
1129/* Find an interface that matches the circuit ID specified in the
1130 Relay Agent Information option. If one is found, store it through
1131 the pointer given; otherwise, leave the existing pointer alone.
1132
1133 We actually deviate somewhat from the current specification here:
1134 if the option buffer is corrupt, we suggest that the caller not
1135 respond to this packet. If the circuit ID doesn't match any known
1136 interface, we suggest that the caller to drop the packet. Only if
1137 we find a circuit ID that matches an existing interface do we tell
1138 the caller to go ahead and process the packet. */
1139
1140static int
1141find_interface_by_agent_option(struct dhcp_packet *packet,
1142 struct interface_info **out,
1143 u_int8_t *buf, int len) {
1144 int i = 0;
1145 u_int8_t *circuit_id = 0;
1146 unsigned circuit_id_len = 0;
1147 struct interface_info *ip;
1148
1149 while (i < len) {
1150 /* If the next agent option overflows the end of the
1151 packet, the agent option buffer is corrupt. */
1152 if (i + 1 == len ||
1153 i + buf[i + 1] + 2 > len) {
1154 ++corrupt_agent_options;
1155 return (-1);
1156 }
1157 switch(buf[i]) {
1158 /* Remember where the circuit ID is... */
1159 case RAI_CIRCUIT_ID:
1160 circuit_id = &buf[i + 2];
1161 circuit_id_len = buf[i + 1];
1162 i += circuit_id_len + 2;
1163 continue;
1164
1165 default:
1166 i += buf[i + 1] + 2;
1167 break;
1168 }
1169 }
1170
1171 /* If there's no circuit ID, it's not really ours, tell the caller
1172 it's no good. */
1173 if (!circuit_id) {
1174 ++missing_circuit_id;
1175 return (-1);
1176 }
1177
1178 /* Scan the interface list looking for an interface whose
1179 name matches the one specified in circuit_id. */
1180
1181 for (ip = interfaces; ip; ip = ip->next) {
1182 if (ip->circuit_id &&
1183 ip->circuit_id_len == circuit_id_len &&
1184 !memcmp(ip->circuit_id, circuit_id, circuit_id_len))
1185 break;
1186 }
1187
1188 /* If we got a match, use it. */
1189 if (ip) {
1190 *out = ip;
1191 return (1);
1192 }
1193
1194 /* If we didn't get a match, the circuit ID was bogus. */
1195 ++bad_circuit_id;
1196 return (-1);
1197}
1198
1199/*
1200 * Examine a packet to see if it's a candidate to have a Relay
1201 * Agent Information option tacked onto its tail. If it is, tack
1202 * the option on.
1203 */
1204static int
1205add_relay_agent_options(struct interface_info *ip, struct dhcp_packet *packet,
1206 unsigned length, struct in_addr giaddr) {
1207 int is_dhcp = 0, mms;
1208 unsigned optlen;
1209 u_int8_t *op, *nextop, *sp, *max, *end_pad = NULL;
1210 int adding_link_select;
1211
1212 /* If we're not adding agent options to packets, we can skip
1213 this. */
1214 if (!add_agent_options)
1215 return (length);
1216
1217 /* If there's no cookie, it's a bootp packet, so we should just
1218 forward it unchanged. */
1219 if (memcmp(packet->options, DHCP_OPTIONS_COOKIE, 4))
1220 return (length);
1221
1222 max = ((u_int8_t *)packet) + dhcp_max_agent_option_packet_length;
1223
1224 /* Add link selection suboption if enabled and we're the first relay */
1225 adding_link_select = (add_rfc3527_suboption
1226 && (packet->giaddr.s_addr == 0));
1227
1228 /* Commence processing after the cookie. */
1229 sp = op = &packet->options[4];
1230
1231 while (op < max) {
1232 switch(*op) {
1233 /* Skip padding... */
1234 case DHO_PAD:
1235 /* Remember the first pad byte so we can commandeer
1236 * padded space.
1237 *
1238 * XXX: Is this really a good idea? Sure, we can
1239 * seemingly reduce the packet while we're looking,
1240 * but if the packet was signed by the client then
1241 * this padding is part of the checksum(RFC3118),
1242 * and its nonpresence would break authentication.
1243 */
1244 if (end_pad == NULL)
1245 end_pad = sp;
1246
1247 if (sp != op)
1248 *sp++ = *op++;
1249 else
1250 sp = ++op;
1251
1252 continue;
1253
1254 /* If we see a message type, it's a DHCP packet. */
1255 case DHO_DHCP_MESSAGE_TYPE:
1256 is_dhcp = 1;
1257 goto skip;
1258
1259 /*
1260 * If there's a maximum message size option, we
1261 * should pay attention to it
1262 */
1263 case DHO_DHCP_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE:
1264 mms = ntohs(*(op + 2));
1265 if (mms < dhcp_max_agent_option_packet_length &&
1266 mms >= DHCP_MTU_MIN)
1267 max = ((u_int8_t *)packet) + mms;
1268 goto skip;
1269
1270 /* Quit immediately if we hit an End option. */
1271 case DHO_END:
1272 goto out;
1273
1274 case DHO_DHCP_AGENT_OPTIONS:
1275 /* We shouldn't see a relay agent option in a
1276 packet before we've seen the DHCP packet type,
1277 but if we do, we have to leave it alone. */
1278 if (!is_dhcp)
1279 goto skip;
1280
1281 end_pad = NULL;
1282
1283 /* There's already a Relay Agent Information option
1284 in this packet. How embarrassing. Decide what
1285 to do based on the mode the user specified. */
1286
1287 switch(agent_relay_mode) {
1288 case forward_and_append:
1289 goto skip;
1290 case forward_untouched:
1291 return (length);
1292 case discard:
1293 return (0);
1294 case forward_and_replace:
1295 default:
1296 break;
1297 }
1298
1299 /* Skip over the agent option and start copying
1300 if we aren't copying already. */
1301 op += op[1] + 2;
1302 break;
1303
1304 skip:
1305 /* Skip over other options. */
1306 default:
1307 /* Fail if processing this option will exceed the
1308 * buffer(op[1] is malformed).
1309 */
1310 nextop = op + op[1] + 2;
1311 if (nextop > max)
1312 return (0);
1313
1314 end_pad = NULL;
1315
1316 if (sp != op) {
1317 memmove(sp, op, op[1] + 2);
1318 sp += op[1] + 2;
1319 op = nextop;
1320 } else
1321 op = sp = nextop;
1322
1323 break;
1324 }
1325 }
1326 out:
1327
1328 /* If it's not a DHCP packet, we're not supposed to touch it. */
1329 if (!is_dhcp)
1330 return (length);
1331
1332 /* If the packet was padded out, we can store the agent option
1333 at the beginning of the padding. */
1334
1335 if (end_pad != NULL)
1336 sp = end_pad;
1337
1338#if 0
1339 /* Remember where the end of the packet was after parsing
1340 it. */
1341 op = sp;
1342#endif
1343
1344 /* Sanity check. Had better not ever happen. */
1345 if ((ip->circuit_id_len > 255) ||(ip->circuit_id_len < 1))
1346 log_fatal("Circuit ID length %d out of range [1-255] on "
1347 "%s\n", ip->circuit_id_len, ip->name);
1348 optlen = ip->circuit_id_len + 2; /* RAI_CIRCUIT_ID + len */
1349
1350 if (ip->remote_id) {
1351 if (ip->remote_id_len > 255 || ip->remote_id_len < 1)
1352 log_fatal("Remote ID length %d out of range [1-255] "
1353 "on %s\n", ip->remote_id_len, ip->name);
1354 optlen += ip->remote_id_len + 2; /* RAI_REMOTE_ID + len */
1355 }
1356
1357 if (adding_link_select) {
1358 optlen += 6;
1359 }
1360
1361#ifdef RELAY_PORT
1362 if (relay_port) {
1363 optlen += 2;
1364 }
1365#endif
1366
1367 /* We do not support relay option fragmenting(multiple options to
1368 * support an option data exceeding 255 bytes).
1369 */
1370 if ((optlen < 3) ||(optlen > 255))
1371 log_fatal("Total agent option length(%u) out of range "
1372 "[3 - 255] on %s\n", optlen, ip->name);
1373
1374 /*
1375 * Is there room for the option, its code+len, and DHO_END?
1376 * If not, forward without adding the option.
1377 */
1378 if (max - sp >= optlen + 3) {
1379 log_debug("Adding %d-byte relay agent option", optlen + 3);
1380
1381 /* Okay, cons up *our* Relay Agent Information option. */
1382 *sp++ = DHO_DHCP_AGENT_OPTIONS;
1383 *sp++ = optlen;
1384
1385 /* Copy in the circuit id... */
1386 *sp++ = RAI_CIRCUIT_ID;
1387 *sp++ = ip->circuit_id_len;
1388 memcpy(sp, ip->circuit_id, ip->circuit_id_len);
1389 sp += ip->circuit_id_len;
1390
1391 /* Copy in remote ID... */
1392 if (ip->remote_id) {
1393 *sp++ = RAI_REMOTE_ID;
1394 *sp++ = ip->remote_id_len;
1395 memcpy(sp, ip->remote_id, ip->remote_id_len);
1396 sp += ip->remote_id_len;
1397 }
1398
1399 /* RFC3527: Use the inbound packet's interface address in
1400 * the link selection suboption and set the outbound giaddr
1401 * to the uplink address. */
1402 if (adding_link_select) {
1403 *sp++ = RAI_LINK_SELECT;
1404 *sp++ = 4u;
1405 memcpy(sp, &giaddr.s_addr, 4);
1406 sp += 4;
1407 packet->giaddr = uplink->addresses[0];
1408 log_debug ("Adding link selection suboption"
1409 " with addr: %s", inet_ntoa(giaddr));
1410 }
1411
1412#ifdef RELAY_PORT
1413 /* draft-ietf-dhc-relay-port-10.txt section 5.1 */
1414 if (relay_port) {
1415 *sp++ = RAI_RELAY_PORT;
1416 *sp++ = 0u;
1417 }
1418#endif
1419 } else {
1420 ++agent_option_errors;
1421 log_error("No room in packet (used %d of %d) "
1422 "for %d-byte relay agent option: omitted",
1423 (int) (sp - ((u_int8_t *) packet)),
1424 (int) (max - ((u_int8_t *) packet)),
1425 optlen + 3);
1426 }
1427
1428 /*
1429 * Deposit an END option unless the packet is full (shouldn't
1430 * be possible).
1431 */
1432 if (sp < max)
1433 *sp++ = DHO_END;
1434
1435 /* Recalculate total packet length. */
1436 length = sp -((u_int8_t *)packet);
1437
1438 /* Make sure the packet isn't short(this is unlikely, but WTH) */
1439 if (length < BOOTP_MIN_LEN) {
1440 memset(sp, DHO_PAD, BOOTP_MIN_LEN - length);
1441 return (BOOTP_MIN_LEN);
1442 }
1443
1444 return (length);
1445}
1446
1447#ifdef DHCPv6
1448/*
1449 * Parse a downstream argument: [address%]interface[#index].
1450 */
1451static struct stream_list *
1452parse_downstream(char *arg) {
1453 struct stream_list *dp, *up;
1454 struct interface_info *ifp = NULL;
1455 char *ifname, *addr, *iid;
1456 isc_result_t status;
1457
1458 if (!supports_multiple_interfaces(ifp) &&
1459 (downstreams != NULL))
1460 log_fatal("No support for multiple interfaces.");
1461
1462 /* Decode the argument. */
1463 ifname = strchr(arg, '%');
1464 if (ifname == NULL) {
1465 ifname = arg;
1466 addr = NULL;
1467 } else {
1468 *ifname++ = '\0';
1469 addr = arg;
1470 }
1471 iid = strchr(ifname, '#');
1472 if (iid != NULL) {
1473 *iid++ = '\0';
1474 }
1475 if (strlen(ifname) >= sizeof(ifp->name)) {
1476 usage("Interface name '%s' too long", ifname);
1477 }
1478
1479 /* Don't declare twice. */
1480 for (dp = downstreams; dp; dp = dp->next) {
1481 if (strcmp(ifname, dp->ifp->name) == 0)
1482 log_fatal("Down interface '%s' declared twice.",
1483 ifname);
1484 }
1485
1486 /* Share with up side? */
1487 for (up = upstreams; up; up = up->next) {
1488 if (strcmp(ifname, up->ifp->name) == 0) {
1489 log_info("parse_downstream: Interface '%s' is "
1490 "both down and up.", ifname);
1491 ifp = up->ifp;
1492 break;
1493 }
1494 }
1495
1496 /* New interface. */
1497 if (ifp == NULL) {
1498 status = interface_allocate(&ifp, MDL);
1499 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1500 log_fatal("%s: interface_allocate: %s",
1501 arg, isc_result_totext(status));
1502 strcpy(ifp->name, ifname);
1503 if (interfaces) {
1504 interface_reference(&ifp->next, interfaces, MDL);
1505 interface_dereference(&interfaces, MDL);
1506 }
1507 interface_reference(&interfaces, ifp, MDL);
1508 }
1509 ifp->flags |= INTERFACE_REQUESTED | INTERFACE_DOWNSTREAM;
1510
1511 /* New downstream. */
1512 dp = (struct stream_list *) dmalloc(sizeof(*dp), MDL);
1513 if (!dp)
1514 log_fatal("No memory for downstream.");
1515 dp->ifp = ifp;
1516 if (iid != NULL) {
1517 dp->id = atoi(iid);
1518 } else {
1519 dp->id = -1;
1520 }
1521 /* !addr case handled by setup. */
1522 if (addr && (inet_pton(AF_INET6, addr, &dp->link.sin6_addr) <= 0))
1523 log_fatal("Bad link address '%s'", addr);
1524
1525 return dp;
1526}
1527
1528/*
1529 * Parse an upstream argument: [address]%interface.
1530 */
1531static struct stream_list *
1532parse_upstream(char *arg) {
1533 struct stream_list *up, *dp;
1534 struct interface_info *ifp = NULL;
1535 char *ifname, *addr;
1536 isc_result_t status;
1537
1538 /* Decode the argument. */
1539 ifname = strchr(arg, '%');
1540 if (ifname == NULL) {
1541 ifname = arg;
1542 addr = All_DHCP_Servers;
1543 } else {
1544 *ifname++ = '\0';
1545 addr = arg;
1546 }
1547 if (strlen(ifname) >= sizeof(ifp->name)) {
1548 log_fatal("Interface name '%s' too long", ifname);
1549 }
1550
1551 /* Shared up interface? */
1552 for (up = upstreams; up; up = up->next) {
1553 if (strcmp(ifname, up->ifp->name) == 0) {
1554 ifp = up->ifp;
1555 break;
1556 }
1557 }
1558 for (dp = downstreams; dp; dp = dp->next) {
1559 if (strcmp(ifname, dp->ifp->name) == 0) {
1560 log_info("parse_upstream: Interface '%s' is "
1561 "both down and up.", ifname);
1562 ifp = dp->ifp;
1563 break;
1564 }
1565 }
1566
1567 /* New interface. */
1568 if (ifp == NULL) {
1569 status = interface_allocate(&ifp, MDL);
1570 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1571 log_fatal("%s: interface_allocate: %s",
1572 arg, isc_result_totext(status));
1573 strcpy(ifp->name, ifname);
1574 if (interfaces) {
1575 interface_reference(&ifp->next, interfaces, MDL);
1576 interface_dereference(&interfaces, MDL);
1577 }
1578 interface_reference(&interfaces, ifp, MDL);
1579 }
1580 ifp->flags |= INTERFACE_REQUESTED | INTERFACE_UPSTREAM;
1581
1582 /* New upstream. */
1583 up = (struct stream_list *) dmalloc(sizeof(*up), MDL);
1584 if (up == NULL)
1585 log_fatal("No memory for upstream.");
1586
1587 up->ifp = ifp;
1588
1589 if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, addr, &up->link.sin6_addr) <= 0)
1590 log_fatal("Bad address %s", addr);
1591
1592 return up;
1593}
1594
1595/*
1596 * Setup downstream interfaces.
1597 */
1598static void
1599setup_streams(void) {
1600 struct stream_list *dp, *up;
1601 int i;
1602 isc_boolean_t link_is_set;
1603
1604 for (dp = downstreams; dp; dp = dp->next) {
1605 /* Check interface */
1606 if (dp->ifp->v6address_count == 0)
1607 log_fatal("Interface '%s' has no IPv6 addresses.",
1608 dp->ifp->name);
1609
1610 /* Check/set link. */
1611 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&dp->link.sin6_addr))
1612 link_is_set = ISC_FALSE;
1613 else
1614 link_is_set = ISC_TRUE;
1615 for (i = 0; i < dp->ifp->v6address_count; i++) {
1616 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&dp->ifp->v6addresses[i]))
1617 continue;
1618 if (!link_is_set)
1619 break;
1620 if (!memcmp(&dp->ifp->v6addresses[i],
1621 &dp->link.sin6_addr,
1622 sizeof(dp->link.sin6_addr)))
1623 break;
1624 }
1625 if (i == dp->ifp->v6address_count)
1626 log_fatal("Interface %s does not have global IPv6 "
1627 "address assigned.", dp->ifp->name);
1628 if (!link_is_set)
1629 memcpy(&dp->link.sin6_addr,
1630 &dp->ifp->v6addresses[i],
1631 sizeof(dp->link.sin6_addr));
1632
1633 /* Set interface-id. */
1634 if (dp->id == -1)
1635 dp->id = dp->ifp->index;
1636 }
1637
1638 for (up = upstreams; up; up = up->next) {
1639 up->link.sin6_port = local_port;
1640 up->link.sin6_family = AF_INET6;
1641#ifdef HAVE_SA_LEN
1642 up->link.sin6_len = sizeof(up->link);
1643#endif
1644
1645 if (up->ifp->v6address_count == 0)
1646 log_fatal("Interface '%s' has no IPv6 addresses.",
1647 up->ifp->name);
1648
1649 /* RFC 3315 Sec 20 - "If the relay agent relays messages to
1650 * the All_DHCP_Servers address or other multicast addresses,
1651 * it sets the Hop Limit field to 32." */
1652 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_MULTICAST(&up->link.sin6_addr)) {
1653 set_multicast_hop_limit(up->ifp, HOP_COUNT_LIMIT);
1654 }
1655 }
1656}
1657
1658/*
1659 * Add DHCPv6 agent options here.
1660 */
1661static const int required_forw_opts[] = {
1662 D6O_INTERFACE_ID,
1663 D6O_SUBSCRIBER_ID,
1664#if defined(RELAY_PORT)
1665 D6O_RELAY_SOURCE_PORT,
1666#endif
1667 D6O_RELAY_MSG,
1668 0
1669};
1670
1671/*
1672 * Process a packet upwards, i.e., from client to server.
1673 */
1674static void
1675process_up6(struct packet *packet, struct stream_list *dp) {
1676 char forw_data[65535];
1677 unsigned cursor;
1678 struct dhcpv6_relay_packet *relay;
1679 struct option_state *opts;
1680 struct stream_list *up;
1681 u_int16_t relay_client_port = 0;
1682
1683 /* Check if the message should be relayed to the server. */
1684 switch (packet->dhcpv6_msg_type) {
1685 case DHCPV6_SOLICIT:
1686 case DHCPV6_REQUEST:
1687 case DHCPV6_CONFIRM:
1688 case DHCPV6_RENEW:
1689 case DHCPV6_REBIND:
1690 case DHCPV6_RELEASE:
1691 case DHCPV6_DECLINE:
1692 case DHCPV6_INFORMATION_REQUEST:
1693 case DHCPV6_RELAY_FORW:
1694 case DHCPV6_LEASEQUERY:
1695 case DHCPV6_DHCPV4_QUERY:
1696 log_info("Relaying %s from %s port %d going up.",
1697 dhcpv6_type_names[packet->dhcpv6_msg_type],
1698 piaddr(packet->client_addr),
1699 ntohs(packet->client_port));
1700 break;
1701
1702 case DHCPV6_ADVERTISE:
1703 case DHCPV6_REPLY:
1704 case DHCPV6_RECONFIGURE:
1705 case DHCPV6_RELAY_REPL:
1706 case DHCPV6_LEASEQUERY_REPLY:
1707 case DHCPV6_DHCPV4_RESPONSE:
1708 log_info("Discarding %s from %s port %d going up.",
1709 dhcpv6_type_names[packet->dhcpv6_msg_type],
1710 piaddr(packet->client_addr),
1711 ntohs(packet->client_port));
1712 return;
1713
1714 default:
1715 log_info("Unknown %d type from %s port %d going up.",
1716 packet->dhcpv6_msg_type,
1717 piaddr(packet->client_addr),
1718 ntohs(packet->client_port));
1719 return;
1720 }
1721
1722 /* Build the relay-forward header. */
1723 relay = (struct dhcpv6_relay_packet *) forw_data;
1724 cursor = offsetof(struct dhcpv6_relay_packet, options);
1725 relay->msg_type = DHCPV6_RELAY_FORW;
1726 if (packet->dhcpv6_msg_type == DHCPV6_RELAY_FORW) {
1727 if (packet->dhcpv6_hop_count >= max_hop_count) {
1728 log_info("Hop count exceeded,");
1729 return;
1730 }
1731 relay->hop_count = packet->dhcpv6_hop_count + 1;
1732 if (dp) {
1733 memcpy(&relay->link_address, &dp->link.sin6_addr, 16);
1734 } else {
1735 /* On smart relay add: && !global. */
1736 if (!use_if_id && downstreams->next) {
1737 log_info("Shan't get back the interface.");
1738 return;
1739 }
1740 memset(&relay->link_address, 0, 16);
1741 }
1742
1743 if (packet->client_port != htons(547)) {
1744 relay_client_port = packet->client_port;
1745 }
1746 } else {
1747 relay->hop_count = 0;
1748 if (!dp)
1749 return;
1750 memcpy(&relay->link_address, &dp->link.sin6_addr, 16);
1751 }
1752 memcpy(&relay->peer_address, packet->client_addr.iabuf, 16);
1753
1754 /* Get an option state. */
1755 opts = NULL;
1756 if (!option_state_allocate(&opts, MDL)) {
1757 log_fatal("No memory for upwards options.");
1758 }
1759
1760 /* Add an interface-id (if used). */
1761 if (use_if_id) {
1762 int if_id;
1763
1764 if (dp) {
1765 if_id = dp->id;
1766 } else if (!downstreams->next) {
1767 if_id = downstreams->id;
1768 } else {
1769 log_info("Don't know the interface.");
1770 option_state_dereference(&opts, MDL);
1771 return;
1772 }
1773
1774 if (!save_option_buffer(&dhcpv6_universe, opts,
1775 NULL, (unsigned char *) &if_id,
1776 sizeof(int),
1777 D6O_INTERFACE_ID, 0)) {
1778 log_error("Can't save interface-id.");
1779 option_state_dereference(&opts, MDL);
1780 return;
1781 }
1782 }
1783
1784 /* Add a subscriber-id if desired. */
1785 /* This is for testing rather than general use */
1786 if (dhcrelay_sub_id != NULL) {
1787 if (!save_option_buffer(&dhcpv6_universe, opts, NULL,
1788 (unsigned char *) dhcrelay_sub_id,
1789 strlen(dhcrelay_sub_id),
1790 D6O_SUBSCRIBER_ID, 0)) {
1791 log_error("Can't save subsriber-id.");
1792 option_state_dereference(&opts, MDL);
1793 return;
1794 }
1795 }
1796
1797
1798#if defined(RELAY_PORT)
1799 /*
1800 * If we use a non-547 UDP source port or if we have received
1801 * from a downstream relay agent uses a non-547 port, we need
1802 * to include the RELAY-SOURCE-PORT option. The "Downstream
1803 * UDP Port" field value in the option allow us to send
1804 * relay-reply message back to the downstream relay agent
1805 * with the correct UDP source port.
1806 */
1807 if (relay_port || relay_client_port) {
1808 if (!save_option_buffer(&dhcpv6_universe, opts, NULL,
1809 (unsigned char *) &relay_client_port,
1810 sizeof(u_int16_t),
1811 D6O_RELAY_SOURCE_PORT, 0)) {
1812 log_error("Can't save relay-source-port.");
1813 option_state_dereference(&opts, MDL);
1814 return;
1815 }
1816 }
1817#else
1818 /* Avoid unused but set warning, */
1819 (void)(relay_client_port);
1820#endif
1821
1822 /* Add the relay-msg carrying the packet. */
1823 if (!save_option_buffer(&dhcpv6_universe, opts,
1824 NULL, (unsigned char *) packet->raw,
1825 packet->packet_length,
1826 D6O_RELAY_MSG, 0)) {
1827 log_error("Can't save relay-msg.");
1828 option_state_dereference(&opts, MDL);
1829 return;
1830 }
1831
1832 /* Finish the relay-forward message. */
1833 cursor += store_options6(forw_data + cursor,
1834 sizeof(forw_data) - cursor,
1835 opts, packet,
1836 required_forw_opts, NULL);
1837 option_state_dereference(&opts, MDL);
1838
1839 /* Send it to all upstreams. */
1840 for (up = upstreams; up; up = up->next) {
1841 send_packet6(up->ifp, (unsigned char *) forw_data,
1842 (size_t) cursor, &up->link);
1843 }
1844}
1845
1846/*
1847 * Process a packet downwards, i.e., from server to client.
1848 */
1849static void
1850process_down6(struct packet *packet) {
1851 struct stream_list *dp;
1852 struct option_cache *oc;
1853 struct data_string relay_msg;
1854 const struct dhcpv6_packet *msg;
1855 struct data_string if_id;
1856#if defined(RELAY_PORT)
1857 struct data_string down_port;
1858#endif
1859 struct sockaddr_in6 to;
1860 struct iaddr peer;
1861
1862 /* The packet must be a relay-reply message. */
1863 if (packet->dhcpv6_msg_type != DHCPV6_RELAY_REPL) {
1864 if (packet->dhcpv6_msg_type < dhcpv6_type_name_max)
1865 log_info("Discarding %s from %s port %d going down.",
1866 dhcpv6_type_names[packet->dhcpv6_msg_type],
1867 piaddr(packet->client_addr),
1868 ntohs(packet->client_port));
1869 else
1870 log_info("Unknown %d type from %s port %d going down.",
1871 packet->dhcpv6_msg_type,
1872 piaddr(packet->client_addr),
1873 ntohs(packet->client_port));
1874 return;
1875 }
1876
1877 /* Inits. */
1878 memset(&relay_msg, 0, sizeof(relay_msg));
1879 memset(&if_id, 0, sizeof(if_id));
1880#if defined(RELAY_PORT)
1881 memset(&down_port, 0, sizeof(down_port));
1882#endif
1883 memset(&to, 0, sizeof(to));
1884 to.sin6_family = AF_INET6;
1885#ifdef HAVE_SA_LEN
1886 to.sin6_len = sizeof(to);
1887#endif
1888 to.sin6_port = remote_port;
1889 peer.len = 16;
1890
1891 /* Get the relay-msg option (carrying the message to relay). */
1892 oc = lookup_option(&dhcpv6_universe, packet->options, D6O_RELAY_MSG);
1893 if (oc == NULL) {
1894 log_info("No relay-msg.");
1895 return;
1896 }
1897 if (!evaluate_option_cache(&relay_msg, packet, NULL, NULL,
1898 packet->options, NULL,
1899 &global_scope, oc, MDL) ||
1900 (relay_msg.len < offsetof(struct dhcpv6_packet, options))) {
1901 log_error("Can't evaluate relay-msg.");
1902 return;
1903 }
1904 msg = (const struct dhcpv6_packet *) relay_msg.data;
1905
1906 /* Get the interface-id (if exists) and the downstream. */
1907 oc = lookup_option(&dhcpv6_universe, packet->options,
1908 D6O_INTERFACE_ID);
1909 if (oc != NULL) {
1910 int if_index;
1911
1912 if (!evaluate_option_cache(&if_id, packet, NULL, NULL,
1913 packet->options, NULL,
1914 &global_scope, oc, MDL) ||
1915 (if_id.len != sizeof(int))) {
1916 log_info("Can't evaluate interface-id.");
1917 goto cleanup;
1918 }
1919 memcpy(&if_index, if_id.data, sizeof(int));
1920 for (dp = downstreams; dp; dp = dp->next) {
1921 if (dp->id == if_index)
1922 break;
1923 }
1924 } else {
1925 if (use_if_id) {
1926 /* Require an interface-id. */
1927 log_info("No interface-id.");
1928 goto cleanup;
1929 }
1930 for (dp = downstreams; dp; dp = dp->next) {
1931 /* Get the first matching one. */
1932 if (!memcmp(&dp->link.sin6_addr,
1933 &packet->dhcpv6_link_address,
1934 sizeof(struct in6_addr)))
1935 break;
1936 }
1937 }
1938 /* Why bother when there is no choice. */
1939 if (!dp && downstreams && !downstreams->next)
1940 dp = downstreams;
1941 if (!dp) {
1942 log_info("Can't find the down interface.");
1943 goto cleanup;
1944 }
1945 memcpy(peer.iabuf, &packet->dhcpv6_peer_address, peer.len);
1946 to.sin6_addr = packet->dhcpv6_peer_address;
1947
1948 /* Check if we should relay the carried message. */
1949 switch (msg->msg_type) {
1950 /* Relay-Reply of for another relay, not a client. */
1951 case DHCPV6_RELAY_REPL:
1952 to.sin6_port = local_port;
1953
1954#if defined(RELAY_PORT)
1955 oc = lookup_option(&dhcpv6_universe, packet->options,
1956 D6O_RELAY_SOURCE_PORT);
1957 if (oc != NULL) {
1958 u_int16_t down_relay_port;
1959
1960 memset(&down_port, 0, sizeof(down_port));
1961 if (!evaluate_option_cache(&down_port, packet, NULL,
1962 NULL, packet->options, NULL,
1963 &global_scope, oc, MDL) ||
1964 (down_port.len != sizeof(u_int16_t))) {
1965 log_info("Can't evaluate down "
1966 "relay-source-port.");
1967 goto cleanup;
1968 }
1969 memcpy(&down_relay_port, down_port.data,
1970 sizeof(u_int16_t));
1971 /*
1972 * If the down_relay_port value is non-zero,
1973 * that means our downstream relay agent uses
1974 * a non-547 UDP source port sending
1975 * relay-forw message to us. We need to use
1976 * the same UDP port sending reply back.
1977 */
1978 if (down_relay_port) {
1979 to.sin6_port = down_relay_port;
1980 }
1981 }
1982#endif
1983
1984 /* Fall into: */
1985
1986 case DHCPV6_ADVERTISE:
1987 case DHCPV6_REPLY:
1988 case DHCPV6_RECONFIGURE:
1989 case DHCPV6_RELAY_FORW:
1990 case DHCPV6_LEASEQUERY_REPLY:
1991 case DHCPV6_DHCPV4_RESPONSE:
1992 log_info("Relaying %s to %s port %d down.",
1993 dhcpv6_type_names[msg->msg_type],
1994 piaddr(peer),
1995 ntohs(to.sin6_port));
1996 break;
1997
1998 case DHCPV6_SOLICIT:
1999 case DHCPV6_REQUEST:
2000 case DHCPV6_CONFIRM:
2001 case DHCPV6_RENEW:
2002 case DHCPV6_REBIND:
2003 case DHCPV6_RELEASE:
2004 case DHCPV6_DECLINE:
2005 case DHCPV6_INFORMATION_REQUEST:
2006 case DHCPV6_LEASEQUERY:
2007 case DHCPV6_DHCPV4_QUERY:
2008 log_info("Discarding %s to %s port %d down.",
2009 dhcpv6_type_names[msg->msg_type],
2010 piaddr(peer),
2011 ntohs(to.sin6_port));
2012 goto cleanup;
2013
2014 default:
2015 log_info("Unknown %d type to %s port %d down.",
2016 msg->msg_type,
2017 piaddr(peer),
2018 ntohs(to.sin6_port));
2019 goto cleanup;
2020 }
2021
2022 /* Send the message to the downstream. */
2023 send_packet6(dp->ifp, (unsigned char *) relay_msg.data,
2024 (size_t) relay_msg.len, &to);
2025
2026 cleanup:
2027 if (relay_msg.data != NULL)
2028 data_string_forget(&relay_msg, MDL);
2029 if (if_id.data != NULL)
2030 data_string_forget(&if_id, MDL);
2031}
2032
2033/*
2034 * Called by the dispatch packet handler with a decoded packet.
2035 */
2036void
2037dhcpv6(struct packet *packet) {
2038 struct stream_list *dp;
2039
2040 /* Try all relay-replies downwards. */
2041 if (packet->dhcpv6_msg_type == DHCPV6_RELAY_REPL) {
2042 process_down6(packet);
2043 return;
2044 }
2045 /* Others are candidates to go up if they come from down. */
2046 for (dp = downstreams; dp; dp = dp->next) {
2047 if (packet->interface != dp->ifp)
2048 continue;
2049 process_up6(packet, dp);
2050 return;
2051 }
2052 /* Relay-forward could work from an unknown interface. */
2053 if (packet->dhcpv6_msg_type == DHCPV6_RELAY_FORW) {
2054 process_up6(packet, NULL);
2055 return;
2056 }
2057
2058 log_info("Can't process packet from interface '%s'.",
2059 packet->interface->name);
2060}
2061#endif
2062
2063/* Stub routines needed for linking with DHCP libraries. */
2064void
2065bootp(struct packet *packet) {
2066 return;
2067}
2068
2069void
2070dhcp(struct packet *packet) {
2071 return;
2072}
2073
2074#if defined(DHCPv6) && defined(DHCP4o6)
2075isc_result_t dhcpv4o6_handler(omapi_object_t *h)
2076{
2077 return ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
2078}
2079#endif
2080
2081void
2082classify(struct packet *p, struct class *c) {
2083 return;
2084}
2085
2086int
2087check_collection(struct packet *p, struct lease *l, struct collection *c) {
2088 return 0;
2089}
2090
2091isc_result_t
2092find_class(struct class **class, const char *c1, const char *c2, int i) {
2093 return ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
2094}
2095
2096int
2097parse_allow_deny(struct option_cache **oc, struct parse *p, int i) {
2098 return 0;
2099}
2100
2101isc_result_t
2102dhcp_set_control_state(control_object_state_t oldstate,
2103 control_object_state_t newstate) {
2104 char buf = 0;
2105
2106 if (newstate != server_shutdown)
2107 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2108
2109 if (no_pid_file == ISC_FALSE)
2110 (void) unlink(path_dhcrelay_pid);
2111
2112 if (!no_daemon && dfd[0] != -1 && dfd[1] != -1) {
2113 IGNORE_RET(write(dfd[1], &buf, 1));
2114 (void) close(dfd[1]);
2115 dfd[0] = dfd[1] = -1;
2116 }
2117 exit(0);
2118}
2119
2120/*!
2121 *
2122 * \brief Allocate an interface as requested with a given set of flags
2123 *
2124 * The requested interface is allocated, its flags field is set to
2125 * INTERFACE_REQUESTED OR'd with the given flags, and then added to
2126 * the list of interfaces.
2127 *
2128 * \param name - name of the requested interface
2129 * \param flags - additional flags for the interface
2130 *
2131 * \return Nothing
2132 */
2133void request_v4_interface(const char* name, int flags) {
2134 struct interface_info *tmp = NULL;
2135 int len = strlen(name);
2136 isc_result_t status;
2137
2138 if (len >= sizeof(tmp->name)) {
2139 log_fatal("%s: interface name too long (is %d)", name, len);
2140 }
2141
2142 status = interface_allocate(&tmp, MDL);
2143 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2144 log_fatal("%s: interface_allocate: %s", name,
2145 isc_result_totext(status));
2146 }
2147
2148 log_debug("Requesting: %s as upstream: %c downstream: %c", name,
2149 (flags & INTERFACE_UPSTREAM ? 'Y' : 'N'),
2150 (flags & INTERFACE_DOWNSTREAM ? 'Y' : 'N'));
2151
2152 strncpy(tmp->name, name, len);
2153 interface_snorf(tmp, (INTERFACE_REQUESTED | flags));
2154 interface_dereference(&tmp, MDL);
2155}
